meanings.definition: A person who manages or looks after something, such as a household or property.
meanings.sent1: The steward of the estate ensured everything was well-maintained.
meanings.sent2: The steward of the ship guided the passengers to their cabins.
meanings.sent3: The steward of the picnic forgot the sandwiches, causing a hungry uproar.
meanings.sent4: She was the steward of kindness, spreading warmth wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The steward of the garden nurtured each plant with care.

meanings.definition: To manage or look after something, such as resources or finances.
meanings.sent1: He had to steward the company's budget wisely to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent2: She will steward the project to ensure it stays on track.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to steward its nuts but kept forgetting where they were buried.
meanings.sent4: She had to steward her time like a precious jewel, allocating it wisely.
meanings.sent5: He learned to steward his energy, pacing himself for the long journey ahead.
